ilfauoredly begin plaie stap thus wrangle partes opponent answerer b playeth opponent playe marchant b playe truth good earnest feckenham pretendeth 〈◊〉 requireth satisfied answereth requestes foresayde proues ye confesse bringeth forth partie opponent scruple still feckenham opponent defendāt either thē respect may either bring proues ye graunt doth ye haue litle occasiō make playe scoffe matter neither doth blemish ye truth frō wher ye would séeme awke blowe foyle b learning founde prooues owne studie helpe friend stapleton owne parte faine confesse right cause ye measure bishop knowledge owne defecte herein ye residue fashiō cōpéeres truth faileth you▪ least winne credite learning selues like prowde pharisies ye dispise al besides selues purpose stapl would staine bishop godly learned labour herein least might séeme owne gathered others hand telling owne well ordered péece worke setteth euery point vttermost cōmende better vnto v great learning industrie apostle time long continued christian neuer acknowledged supremacie sea rome confirmed like recordes church southward remaine beginning apostle sea rome also continuance howe woulde admitte anye supremacie sea ouer contention thereabout confirmation sea rome euen emperour yea bishop rome himselfe prince practise come thereto shall shewe east warde southwarde may like wise reason church ought shewe lowly submission necessarie craue requisite may ye easily finde hir highnesse mercifull gratious mocking sort ye pretende craue earnestly borne withall vpon sodayne andstap 21 abandon fayth baptised bicause abandon pope without sure substantiall ground abandon faythe vve vvere baptised sée wicked slaunder couer disobediēce ye charge gratious prince withall though went make renie fayth ye vvere baptised ye doe euen ye pretende kneele knee vvith moste humble lowely submission sée cankred heart ye beare counterfayte crouching ye knowe stap fayth ye baptised least ye rightely baptised true christian man name fayth obedience pope name fayth obedience father sonne holy ghost fayth q maiestie goeth little haue abandon hir grace supreme gouernemēt chiefly directed end haue ye without superstition error idolatrie pollution therof kéepe maintein inuiolate baptisme ye promised therfore subiect like though ye knee neuer muche accuse hir highnesse cause ye abandon fayth ye baptised requireth ye kéepe abandon neither soden leisure cause refusall obedience hir grace neuer denied ye doe slaunder hir néeded ye haue runne away shew yet disobedience hir authoritie since euer graunted maynteined thing ye séeme craue howbeit counterfeite humilitie detecteth selfe stubborne disobedience ye pretende craue one thing ye entende another thing ye would borne still refuse grace supreme authoritie ouer ecclesiasticall cause thing deede ye meane ye would rather borne withall bicause matter commeth vpon sodaine therefore ye vpon sodaine graunt déede st ye pretende reason weightie matter require done sodeyne passion deliberation▪ sodeyne matter yet vnto ye neuer heare questiō haue ye leasure deliberate thereon seeth ye neuer much leasure matter would still come vpon sodeyne reason ye must haue time take aduisement vpō take leasure feare ye become obedient subiect vpon sodeyne ye craue remayne still vpon deliberation obstinate enemie st pretēding refusall abandoning faith christened procéedeth assured auncetours maiestiesstapl 21 b owne noble progenitours yea owne noble father king henrie eight yea faith clerkly booke hath pithily defended thereby atchieued transported hereditarie succession worthie title stile yet remayning highnesse defendour faith ye slaunder wickedly quéenes maiestie cause ye abandon faith baptisme▪ ye slaunder al auncestors famouse prince highnesse father k henrie 8 christened faith pope obedience hereof ye say ye assured assured euident false although father q maiesties father also yea many v selues q maiestie also selfe borne baptised errours poperie many chiefly abounde yet one said baptised errours helde baptised kept right formall word baptisme baptise thée name ye father sonne holy ghost thā old time childrē themselues could saide baptised errours helde nouatians donatist rogatists pelagians heretikes notwithstāding kept right element formal word baptisme neither papist say dissuadeth popish errours goeth abandon faith wherein baptized thā pelagian heretike moued forsake heresie could pretēd moued forsake faith baptised bicause baptised yea auncesters pelagians c ye therefore st make distinction betwene faith baptisme faith popish church putteth diuers erronious pointes doctrine faith k henrie 8▪ q maiesties mostthe booke k henrie eyght noble father set booke ye mencion therby labour stayne q maiestie setting contrarie faith father parte st shew extreme malice nothing subiectlike blemish highnesse famous renown father notwithstanding ye cā king father answere howbeit booke clerkly yet clerklines one thing truth maruel thē wrote defence doctrine whē popish prelate hid ye truth frō bore hand falshoodes truth till pleased god suffer noble prince longer deluded false prelate first question according measure merciful rich reueled truth vnto chance ye speake faith clerkly sincere doctrine set thē pope q maiestie herein proper questiō hād followeth zealously steppe highnesse father wherein abused many prince false teacher forsooke errours abolished false teacher captaines vsurped authoritie yt obeyed truth reueled clerkly bookes worldly glory securitie aduentured himselfe kingdome enemy setting forth truth gouerning subiects ye word god though plentifully set forth wéedes thoroughly rooted vp reason false gardiner trusted ouer much howbeit lēgth thanks god espied also procéeded furder god lent furder life yet rather commended euil spoken euell thought could throughly bring passe time left vertuouse sonne king edwarde bring perfection queenes place proceedeth like truth wisedome albeit pope authoritie euer chiefe matter ecclesiasticall yet neuer much noddie say beleue pope raigned pope king euer two distinct person farre different one seuerall function administration yet well concurrant coincident togither without imminution one others authoritie answere like truth wisdome ye reasoned ye frame also reason ye say say would haue pope raigne place ergo ye say would haue pope king hereupon ye make distinction raigning hauing supreme authoritie ye conclude neuer much noddie say beleeue pope raigned first argument faultie putting case yethe pope reigne englande shame say ye would haue king yet tooke principall parte royall power raigne place though claymed king since ye vaunt wisedome wise distinction raygning hauing supreme authoritie bleare simple eye woordes farre forth claymeth supreme authoritie doth supreme matter ecclesiasticall ouer well farre foorth claymeth raygne ouer nowe parte royall power deth clayme raigne euen ouer principall parte king thereof say euer much noddie say raygned sir noddie euen pope maketh clayme selfe say although greatly lie therin euer chiefe matter ecclesiasticall complices say raigneth spirituall matter ouer christendome yea wil go temporalty pray sauing reuerence noddie raygned heere certayne dayes pope legate kept crowne englande king iohn gaue agayne making king become highnesse went play minister ye meane antecedent true ecclesiasticall authoritie nothing toucheth hir person crowne▪ without whiche hath honorably continued flourished many hundreth yeres shall god grace continue ful wel ful long agayne shal please god spitefull slaunder say quéene taketh vpon hir eccl authoritie vnited hir person crowne euident false therefore crowne flourisheth suche matter owne supreme gouernement aboute 〈◊〉 matter make sownde though onely béene ayders assisters aduocates vnto others selues doer whereas contrarie verye doer thoughe action appert •… yned minister office yet gouerning directing bothe minister action yea principall ouerséers supreme ruler euen déedes wordes rehearsed plainly declare thys shyft aduocation long sithence theyr tymes deuysed whiche office aduocateshippe séemeth bée de •… yued fonde errour papistes seculer power immediately primarelye terme pope hath also immediatelye exercise execution gyueth prince prince becommeth pope aduocate rather executioner thus first say carolus magnus pope adrian aduocate executing byshoppe rome agaynste desiderius king lumbardie wherevpon charles made emperour pope notwithstanding michaell emperour lyuing constantinople propter hoc dicunt sayeth dantesdantes alegherius li 3 aligherius quòd omnes qui fuerunt romanorum imperatores post ipsum ipse aduocat •… ecclesiae sunt debent ab ecclesia aduocari thys thyng emperours rome hym hee hym selfe aduocates churche oughte churche called vpon lupolous de babenberge also telleth pope zacharielupold de babenb ca 15 declarauit c declared pronounced childericus pepin master shoulde deposed pepine made king fraunce whome pope steuen seconde annoynted sonnes carolus carolomanus french king ipsos specialiter elegit sayth lupoldus ad sedem apostolicam defendendam ex hac electione puto que reges imperatores romanorum sint v que hodiernum diem ecclesia romanae aduocati de qua aduocatia loquuntur iura canonica chose especially defende apostolicall sea election thinke commeth kinges emperours romaynes euen daye aduocates romayne churche whiche aduocacie speake canonicall lawes thus sée originall deuised aduocateship commeth nothing neare example sayde godly prince béeing themselues supreme gouernours ecclesiasticall matter aduocateshippe first hatched reason therefore punie shoulde debarre seniour yet sielie shift canonistes descant rather detecting vnlawfull encroching pope defeating anye parte prince authoritie hys supreme gouernement prince carolus magnus sonnes emperours since theyr tymes nothing suche aduocates pope woulde nowe pretende say onelye executioner story testifie euen aduocates also chiefe directours supreme gouernours thing yea pope hym selfe well anye byshoppe theyr territoryes subiecte ayded assisted byshoppe rome graunt humblie aduocated called vppon ayde assystance agaynst wrongers pope commaundement called obeyed calling became aduocates cleane contrarie aduocates office therefore agayne argument nought aiders aduocates ergo supreme gouernours st proue former ensamples supreme gouernement appertayne prince supreme gouernement sayth hauestap 30 vnlesse selfe spirituall man man master shippe neuer mariner maior neuer citizen hys principal gouernement resting ciuill matter respecte haue sayde supreme gouernour person realme action suche sense haue specified least action spirituall men especially appropriate vnlesse selfe spirituall man frame similitude vnproportionably mthough prince eccl person yet hath supremacie eccl cause stap▪ master shippe maior citie prince supreme gouernour either béeing particuler office vnder supreme gouernour maketh lawes euen maiors city master shippes also▪ albeit argumēt builded similitude firme proue improue controuersie though rightly applied may lightē matter assenteth enforce denieth notwithstanding similitude proue nothing nothing lighten obscure matter yet similitude admitted frō maior pilot supreme gouernour true conclusion ye inferre vpon ensamples ye make similitude matter ye apply false man may master shippe though neuer maryner shippe also •… e made maior towne wherein neuer citizen many noble gentleman made captayne forte towne armie neuer prest souldier yet good captayne hauing knowledge howe gouerne souldiers though selfe none yea draw néerer mariner maiors captaines reade ye ambrose neuer much clergie baptized yet better byshop best bishop romish making byshop rome selfe yea holy pope felix 5 pope ye call méere lay man neither cardinall byshop priest much reade benet collet therfore example vniuersall church according definition sauiour vnited togither founded vpon rocke peter confession necessarie remayne saluation soules obey keeping fayth confession thereof sentence well expoundeth church peter say church vnited founded vpon rocke peter confession peter rule patrimonie confession rocke onely christe corner stone whome onely churche founded whome liuely story buylding vnited churche déede muste obedient remayne kéeping fayth confession thereof doth proue obedience pope church dothe rather detect church vniuersal church wherof maximus speaketh christ hath defined howsoeuer neyther hir supreme power authoritie vnder god whitte empayred thereby argument abase prince supreme power authoritie shall also abase priest ought doe thing execute god determination ought power lay man alleaging scripture whole councell togither famous doctor iohn gerso •… chauncelour vniuersitie paris sayth prima verit •… 〈◊〉 stat c thisiohn gerson truthe standeth first weete simple man beeing authorized may excellently learned holy writ muste beleeue assertion case doctrine pope declaration bicause euident must beleeue gospell pope neither sayth thus pope alone euen councels yea generall councels sacris c vve must beleeue excellent learned man scripture alleaging catholike authoritie muste beleeue euen generall councell thus owne doctor yea pope selfe sayth proofe oughte toinnocentius 3 c cum vene de except admitted agaynst scripture may muste abandon councels wherein many thing besides many thinges expressely agaynst scripture determined truthe expresse truthe doth master feckenham bishop sheweth haue bene saint augustine calleth odious wicked guile donatistes thereon concludeth eyther must shunne suche heriticall shiftes else following error defence shift hither good reader sayth master stapleton masterstap 56 horne althoughe vntruely yet hath hee somewhat orderly proceeded followeth vntill come 20 leafe beside impudent shamefull lye wherewith woulde deface master feckenham prosecuteth matter confusedly vnorderly leaping cannot tell howe whether verily thinke wittes owne perchaunce encombred domesticall affayres home could gather thē togither lesse passed hodge potch made doings thinking like fellowes protestantes woulde take thinges good gree knowing poore master feckenham shutre vp close ynough aunswering thinking catholike else would circumspect perceiue memory could haue made one lye haue hanged better another howe hanges thys togither ye answere iumbleth testimonie two newe testament ye say thought master horne old testament ye first make ourthe papistes confesse make greater conscience man decree thā g •… d word selues greater conscience transgression church monkishe decree transgression diuine precept secondly hereon prescribed order thing thing iudged thing thēselues euill vnlawfull •… thither againe trust workes whiche woulde haue farre surely chaūced exacted thing nowe perceyne committed church constitution euen sone euer cōstitutions began giuen men began also therwith trust little little wethe papistes confesse selues bee phariseys haue degenerate true godlinesse kinde pharisaical righteousnesse rather shew righteousnesse cleare denyed afterwarde complayning popishe fastes abuse sayth simile sunt pleri que nostrum c ferus ca 12 math men like vnto meaneth phareseys iudge keepe lawes follow externally letter law nothing lesse appeareth ydle feast dayes giue themselues ryot neglecting thinges perteyning sabaoth also thinkemisiudging fasting fast eate day daintilye glutte themselues feele hunger day long contrarie iudge fast transgresse commaundement compelled pouertie necessitie labour doth eate sparingly often tymes day little thinges doe flatly fight doctrine christ first impugneth fayth secondly charitie two christ chiefly touch cause therefore doeth often blame marke selues shall see selues euen culpable thinges commonly righteousnessethe popishe righteousnesse worse phariseys outwarde thing two thing commaunded keeping sabaoth two thing euery precept heart outward work ecclesiasticall constitution apparell set outwarde thinges damne outwarde thinges hauing right wittes woulde coulde say suffice saluation sayd litle precept keeping sabaoth two thing commaunded first body rest secondly principally rest old man workes say euery precept requireth two thinges wete outwarde worke heart principally christ declared inough math 5 wee neglecting principally exacted stick onely externall thing may say ecclesiastical cōstitutions giue holinesse shewe ensample true religion consisteth thou shouldst weare habit thou dead world thou liue god point outward thing also litle thee true worship god spirite truth thou worship father hereto externall worship doth stirre thee vp also said fasting cōfession prayer c chiefly cōsist hart neglectingthe papist abuse thing thing necessarie please selues outwarde thing onely thus sayth ferus popishe fast conteyning farre worse error aerius putting difference belike shalbe aerian third thing st obiecteth v aerius issacrifice deade sayd sacrifice dead fruitlesse also dead fruitlesse trouthaerius againe belyed master stapleton ye would neuer make lying sacrifice priestes lippes shame though aerius counted heretike denying propiciatorie sacrifice ye call masse ye say auaylable meritorious onely liuing also deade deliuer fayned paynes purgatorie whereas affirmed time thing haue bene counted straunge new monstrous heretike long neither pardon indulgence trental diriges neyther satissactions oblation neither masse requiem soule priestes sing say extant deuised errours déede dead long suche gaue occasion gainfull deuises aerius denyed errours errours bene practised béene heretike denying rather heretikes mainteyned godly father acknowledged knew place eyther ioy torment lyfe onely heauen hell thirde place sayth saint augustine writeth thyshypognost lib 5 aerius penitus ignoramus vve vtterly ignorant finde scripture yet must saint augustine néedes haue knowne acknowledged thirde place deliueraunce deade ment prayer oblation theyr deliuerance meane flatly denieth knowing place followethsaint august knevv purging place deade wryting thus aerius either heresie denying place dead holpen wherto praier serue oblation deliuering place torment since place torment confirmed aerius saying else must runne yet greater error absurditie deade one two place heauen hell holpen prayer oblation hell scripture flatte theirmarke 9 worme shall neuer die fire vnquenchable euerlasting riche glutton coulde get thence norluke 16 finde neuer little ease torment ab inferno nulla est redemptio hell redemption knewe saint augustine well ynough sayth duae de verbis apostoli serm 18 quippe habitationes vna igne hir euen much say ye stap haue ye shifte descant runne vnto distinction behinde alleage figge leafe couer shame kinde inuocation may thought idolatrie creature blasphemie god well serue giue pray doctrine haue bene taught printed hereafter haue regarde owne soules health beléeue false prophet ye spare deceyue spared blasphenie god ye say generall haue shewed many owne confession yea euen masse onely inuocated besides onely intercessours orate pronobis ascribed helpe also yea almost one saint mencioned whole legende whome ye attribute proper vertue wherein ye inuocate hir onely intercessour neuer muche excellent thus august make papist heretikes since ye would haue proued v heretikes epiphanius let v sée nowe ye stande epiphanius iudgement inuocation euen virgin marie euen began erroure god therefore little ascribeth hir bothe beginning treaiise ende maketh inuocations onely god saying beginning nunc autem clarè c let v clearely speake heresie selfe inuocating god adioyne confutation •… k vp hir husbandes worde wife may speake appointe much thinkes good husbande hath wordes say heard wiues worde beare streake giue authoritie husbandes worde according common saying good man saith say goodwife saith must good reason reason cleane reason may replie pigghius st better reason▪ church authoritie beleefe ought net onely called doubte▪ whether agrée god worde also ought depend wholy onely authoritie god worde rather authoritie worde god called doubte much lesse denied wickedly presumeth speake much better reason matth 11 cast sea christ saith sléede milstone ceremony hanged aboute necke blasphemous swine pigghius caried hedlōg sea yea saith christ heauen earth shall passe worde shall passe matth 24 catholike church st true wife spouse sonne god would lowlinesse humilitie reuerence regarde obey christ hir husbandes worde content commaunded countermaunde thinke force vnlesse gaue authoritie thereunto adde diminishe commaunde one thing commaundes another falshoodstapl 63 b seconde motiue moued bishop chalenge feck followe donatiste •… great follie doth also shew selfe aswell imagine donatiste thinke say say ciuill magistrate haue religion may punishe transgressours master feckenham saith thing suppose thinketh thing furder dare bold say much light coniecture grounded thereof feckenhams word vnlesse horne become suddenly subtile thinketh difference say prince punishe honest true man steede theefe say punishe theefe say difference betwixt thinges nothing though feckenham catholikes denie ciuill prince supreme gouernment cause ecclesiasticall yet doth feckenham catholike denie ciuill prince may deale matter ecclesiasticall aduocates defender churche namely punishing heretikes sharpe lawes vnto whiche lawes heretikes church first giuen vp deliuered open excommunication condemnation first ye motiue againe ye charge bishop falshood folly take héede stapleton falshood follie light owne pate whether follie crafte let déeme certainely falshood ye come setting downe bishop wordes distincte letter ye dare eares head set downe full wordes bishop augustine yet donatistes whereby might haue bene knowne donatistes attributed denied prince néere farre ye come vnto diffred thus durst ye thus ye haue done argueth owne falsehood ye turne catte panne say donatistes saide ciuill magistrate haue religion may punishe transgressours say feckēham saith thing suppose thinketh thing furder ye dare bolde say much light coniecture grounded thereof feckenhams wordes hereon conclude donatiste since ye thus bolde feckenham enter thought ye haue bene afrayde byshop haue set downe playne written wordes muche full content therof ye feare would bite ye déede woulde haue shewed haue bene donatist would haue shewed howe ye haue altered master stapleton meane say eusebius wouldstap 68 soone confounde reherse constantine whole sentence spake bishop good year meane ye st ye vrge meaning néedes b meane make emperor bishop ye bishoply ministerie therfore curtalled ye call eusebius sentence eusebius sentence set downe whole ye list confound yt meane confound office neuer soone late confound b popish bishop may rather confounde true meaning therof euseb de vita const li 4 saith speaking spirituall pastours bishop thinges churche done within inwardly appointed god bishop thing forthout outwardly say bishoply office god willing authoritie offer incense vvhat therfore sayth priest lawfull thee ozias offer incense behold libertie behold mind knoweth bōdage behold tong touching heauens behold liberty cannot restrained behold body mā mind angel behold one goeth groūd cōuersant heauē thou sawest king thou sawest diademe tel kingdom transgression lawes lawful thee king offer incēse lawful thee come holy holy thou passest thy boūds thou sekest thing graūted thee therfore shalt leese thing thou hast receiued lawful thee offer incēse giuen vnto priest thine mine haue vsurped thy purple vsurpe thou priesthod fayling first worde superiour béeing vnderstoode two way either respect ministerie function respect publique ouersight ordering direction former sense maior true priest superiour prince respect ministerie function worde superiour béeing thus vnderstoode conclusion superioritie onely ministerie function concludeth nothing agaynst prince superioritie publike ouersight ordering direction superiour ministerie function abused word superiour thus vnderstoode simply superiour later sense say priest superiour publike ouersight ordering direction office duely administred minister maior false priest thus prince superiour second fallation word remission sinnes meane thereby ouersighte sée suche remission duely made priest maior also false priest prince superiour therin mean remission sinnes action remitting function office pronouncing remitted maior true minor false remission sin cause ecclesiasticall action function ecclesiasticall wheron ariseth third fallation word bishop bleare reader eye zeale stapleton cōmendable ment good soothe bishop bleared reader eye simply plainly set downe truth euen bleared eye cleane blinded ouermuch affection might well beholde rather feared ye played pretending dissipate discusse mistes déede none ye raysed mistes caste cloudes least reader haue espied matter though reader eye cleere ye would bleare dimme bleare eyed whit ye would soone mende matter make starke blinde euen ye eftsones bishop alleaging emperours stayeth frō breaking going foorth▪ ye suffer bishop bleare reader eye yet thing bishop emperours alleageth soeuer matter meane ye answere one worde except answere say sette hare head goose iublettes set one allegation another bishop hath bleared readershow stapl answeres bishop allegation eye cited long dealing blearing eye hath bishop vsed hauing faithfully set downe emperours owne wordes fully shew theodosius minde fully proue present question conclude prince supreme authoritie well ecclesiasticall matter temporall master stap thought best answere one worde let goe telling v emperours saying doings serue nothing ourobscuritie pretensed primacie wandring ob scure generalitie may well called iudgement▪ determining approbation ye thinke true religion good doctrine bishop hath omitted care prouide direct set foorth without iudgement without determining good true without approbation side errours heresy false naughtie doctrine bishop named thinke ye visiting reforming restrayning amending correcting without iudgement determination agaynst sithe playne spéeche ascribeth prince fully answereth ye call sayd ye vnderstande iudgement determining approuing right ye shewe continuall wrangler ye cause giuen incontinent ye declare ye meane iudgement doctrine say necessarie churche supreme gouernour therof shoulde haue power doubtes controuersies decide truthe make ende questioning statute master horne silence comprised true déede stapl kinde iudgement notthe statute slaundred mentioned bishop▪ moste falsly mentioned ye say statute moste maliciously ye slaunder statute statute neither named comprised gathered thereon neither quéenes maiestie claymeth taketh hir kinde iudgement due onely god worde pope popishe churche violently snatcheth god worde chalenging selues euen aboue god worde selfe although agrée héerein togither popishe churche aboue pope thys poynt iudgement maugre bearde yet graunt pope supreme gouernour ecclesiasticall though relent supremethe popishe churche claymeth superioritie iudgeging doctrine aboue pope iudgement giue church iudgement hath true copie god lawe muste haue priest dothe keeping argue greater authoritie▪ king must haue ye crowne kéeper crowne seale keeper seale keeper therefore greater nay rather argueth althoughe andthe church disposition thing indifferent dispose thing nature indifferent profite whole mysticall body part thereof thing called spirituall thing properly owne nature spirituall cause spirituall person vse yet freely lefte church disposition principall person church prince pastor haue chiefest stroke disposition free euery member churche shoulde haue nay yea disposing thē would disposed atto whome church disposition indifferent thing belongeth thing meere spirituall thing spirituall respect length would peraduenture fall end little profite whole mysticall body woulde rather hinderaunce disquieting besides spiritual thinges great many whiche déede méere spirituall worde god sacramentes christ article fayth commaundementes life suche thinges god hathe either expressed worde necessarily conteyued thinges béeing spiritual vnder churche christ churche may freely dispose decree statly dispose decreemeere spiritual thinges may otherwise disposed churche churche alter swarue one iote whiche shoulde shoulde profite hir selfe whole mysticall body destroy hir selfe dissolue whole body euery part therof thing estate king kingdome whiche althoughe méere spirituall thing farre foorthe spirituall selfe confesse yet bicause ordinaunce god god hath worde set foorthe office king declarethwhat kinde thing state king kingdome setting vp pulling downe kinges alteration kingdomes belongeth selfe neuer gaue authoritie churche muche lesse minister set vp depose kinges alter kingdomes kinges therefore kingdomes spirituall thinges vnder churche christe maye freely dispose decree profite whole mysticall body neither hathe whole mysticall body thraldome lesse fredome king kingdomes vnder hir maye freely dispose decree shall thinke moste profitable whole mysticall body hathe worde1 reg 15 lorde lorde hath caste thee thou shouldest king yet sayth héere depose thee▪ lorde deposeth thée thine estate frō hencefoorth thou shalte neither king reputed taken churche god king
